text: Sik Kok Kwong, GBM GBS (16 May 1919 â€“ 16 November 2014) was a Tiantai Buddhist monk from Hong Kong. He was the first president of the Hong Kong Buddhist Association. He was also the Honorary Vice-President of the World Buddhist Sangha Council, a member of the Hong Kong Basic Law Drafting Committee, and a Hong Kong Affairs Advisor. Kwong died in Happy Valley, Hong Kong, aged 95. ==References== Category:1919 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Buddhist clergy Category:Hong Kong people Category:Buddhist monks
